p: Polysaccharides, as a kind of biological macromolecules, have aroused more and more attention in the past ten years because of their relatively low toxicity and diverse biological activities, such as antitumor [ 3, 4], antidiabetic [ 5], hypoglycemic [ 6, 7], antiviral and immune regulatory effects [ 8]. In particular, natural polysaccharides have become a promising and valuable source of therapeutic agents for the treatment of cancer recently. More and more reports have pointed out that natural polysaccharides had significant anti-proliferation activities against various tumor cell lines of human origin such as HepG2, SiHa, MDA-MB-231, A549, KB, BXCP-3, SGC-7901, Hela, MCF-7 cells [ 9, 10, 11], and could induce apoptosis in them [ 12, 13].
